wpPost.title: How to Get Product Image URL in Magento 2
wpPost.content:
Magento 2 is an open-source e-commerce platform that provides a wide range of features and functionalities to manage and customize an online store. With its user-friendly interface and robust architecture, Magento 2 enables merchants to easily create and manage their product catalog, process orders, handle shipping and tax settings, manage customer accounts and more. One of the most important aspects of an e-commerce store is product images, as they help customers visualize the product and make informed purchasing decisions. 

Overall, the goal of this blog is to provide a comprehensive guide to retrieving and using the product image URL in Magento 2, to help merchants enhance the user experience on their online store and drive better results.

Hence, it’s crucial for merchants to have access to the its image URLs to use them for various purposes such as email marketing, product comparison, or to simply display on their website. In this article, we will discuss how to get product image URL in Magento 2, and the different ways to use it to enhance the user experience on your online store.

What are the Needs to get Image URL in Magento 2 

There are several reasons why it’s important to get it done. Some of these reasons include:

Product Comparison: 

Its image URLs can be used to display product images in a product comparison page. This allows customers to compare the different products side-by-side and make informed purchasing decisions.

Email Marketing: 

Product image URLs can be used to include product images in email marketing campaigns, such as product promotion emails, newsletter, or abandoned cart recovery emails. This can help to increase customer engagement and drive sales.

Product Pages: 

It can be used to unhide all product images on product pages. This helps customers to visualize the product thoroughly and makes it easier for them to decide whether to purchase it or not.

Third-Party Integrations: 

Its image URLs can be used to integrate your Magento 2 store with other platforms, such as social media or marketplace websites. This allows you to showcase you it on these platforms and reach a wider audience.

Custom Templates: 

It’s image URLs can be used to display product images in custom templates, such as custom product listings or category pages. This can help you to create a more personalized and unique shopping experience for your customers.

Overall, getting its URL in Magento 2 is essential for merchants to effectively manage and display images on their online store, and to drive better results.

Steps to get product image url in Magento 2

There are two ways to get product image URL in Magento 2:

1. Using Product Repository

These class is a convenient way to retrieve its data from the database. You can use this class to get the product image URL by loading the product and then getting the image URL from the product object.

To get the its URL using the above given Repository class, you need to follow these steps:

1. First, you need to create an instance of its Repository class in your class.

php

protected $_productRepository;

public function __construct(

    \Magento\Catalog\Api\ProductRepositoryInterface $productRepository

) {

    $this->_productRepository = $productRepository;

}

2. Load the product using the Product Repository class.

bash

$product = $this->_productRepository->getById($productId);

3. Get the image URL from the product object.

bash

$imageUrl = $product->getImageUrl();

2. Using Object Manager

The Object Manager is a class that is responsible for instantiating objects in Magento 2. You can use the Object Manager to get the product image URL by loading it and then getting the image URL from the product object.

To get the image URL using the Object Manager, you need to follow these steps:

1. First, you need to create an instance of the Object Manager class in your class.

php

protected $_objectManager;

public function __construct(

    \Magento\Framework\ObjectManagerInterface $objectManager

) {

    $this->_objectManager = $objectManager;

}

2. Load the product using the Object Manager.

bash

$product = $this->_objectManager->create('Magento\Catalog\Model\Product')->load($productId);

3. Get the image URL from the product object.

bash

$imageUrl = $product->getImageUrl();

Conclusion

In this article, we have discussed two ways to get the product image URL in Magento 2. Both ways are simple and easy to use. You can choose the method that suits your needs and implement it in your store. If you have any questions or need further assistance, please feel free to ask.
